definition: an act of violence or brutality

examples: do no outrages on silly women or poor passengers

definition: an act that violates accepted standards of behavior or taste
examples: an outrage alike against decency and dignity

definition: the anger and resentment aroused by injury or insult
examples: Many people expressed outrage at the court's decision.

definition: to violate the standards or principles of
examples: he has outraged respectability past endurance

definition: to arouse anger or resentment in usually by some grave offense
